metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11754 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
When the pointer lock is enabled by a website though requestPointerLock(),no user notification is given. This could allow a malicious website tohijack the mouse pointer and confuse users. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 69.0.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
